StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveShipperPostEnlistmentDisclosure]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @ID uniqueiden..er, @ShipperID int, @Disclosure varchar(500), @DisclosureSourceID int, @DisclosureCriteriaID int, @LastEditBy varchar(200) ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [USMC].[Shipper_PostEnlistmentDisclosure] WHERE [ID] = @ID) BEGIN UPDATE [USMC].[Shipper_PostEnlistmentDisclosure] SET [ShipperID] = @ShipperID, [Disclosure] = @Disclosure, [DisclosureSourceID] = @DisclosureSourceID, [DisclosureCriteriaID] = @DisclosureCriteriaID WHERE [ID] = @ID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [USMC].[Shipper_PostEnlistmentDisclosure] ( [ID], [ShipperID], [Disclosure], [DisclosureSourceID], [DisclosureCriteriaID] ) VALUES ( @ID, @ShipperID, @Disclosure, @DisclosureSourceID, @DisclosureCriteriaID )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
